alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 8:50PM CDT until April 04 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN JEFFERSON AND SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON COUNTIES... At 848 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Amazonia to 3 miles southeast of Valley Falls, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. Emergency Managers reported dime- sized hail over northern Shawnee and southern Jefferson county at 849 PM. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Valley Falls, Oskaloosa, McLouth, Ozawkie, Nortonville and Winchester. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
